name: petroleum refinery construction | petroleum refinery | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8851/documentation

The inventory describes the use of materials for the refinery equipment and the land use for a refinery with an annual capacity of 1 mio. tonnes crude oil throughput and a life time of 30 years. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Infrastructure for chemical processing and land use. No data for construction, storage facilities and office buildings.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time of publications and information in the literature
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Estimation for a refinery in Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data for a distillation unit have been estimated to assess the use of materials.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From single plant parts to whole refinery. This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
